description.narrative: The project will improve the employability of graduates from technical and vocational education and training (TVET) programs and courses in three priority sectors of the economy in Mongolia: agriculture, construction, and road and transportation. The project, which has several innovative features, will (i) develop an industry-driven TVET system; (ii) upgrade selected TVET providers to implement competency-based training and assessment; (iii) establish training systems for TVET teachers and managers; (iv) support secondary education career guidance and schools that specialize in technology; and (v) establish an effective project management system.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

description.narrative: Enhanced responsiveness of the TVET system to labor market demand in the three priority sectors.

title.narrative: Reports and Recommendations of the President

15,500 students have obtained completion certificates of CBT programs and courses for the key occupations in the priority sectors developed in collaboration with employers, and industry and professional associations, of which 2,800 (18.1%) are female students (2012 baseline: 14.8%)

description.narrative: Enhanced responsiveness of the TVET system to labor market demand in the three priority sectors.

title.narrative: 3,000 students certified in the key occupations at the assessment and certification centers

description.narrative: Enhanced responsiveness of the TVET system to labor market demand in the three priority sectors.

title.narrative: Eighth and ninth grade students in all schools have gender-sensitive career guidance integrated with national instructional plan

description.narrative: Enhanced responsiveness of the TVET system to labor market demand in the three priority sectors.
